intro: Loasa calycina, commonly known as the velvetleaf loasa, is a perennial shrub native to the southeastern United States. It features heart-shaped, velvety leaves that are often tinged with purple or red on the underside. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Loasa calycina is characterized by its woody stems and is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and streambanks. Its botanical structure makes it a distinctive member of the Malvaceae family.
